page.title: 10THE FARMING YEAR
page.content: The early part of the year is spent feeding and tending the stock. Cattle have silage, sheep have hay and all the animals have concentrates as supplementary feed. Lambing starts at the end of March and continues until early May. In May the cattle kept indoors come out to grass. In June silaging is done. The making of silage on a large scale has only been introduced into the Dales during the last ten years. Hay-making is in July. Sheep are sheared in June/July and there are two compulsory dippings before August. In August the lambs are weaned and in September and October lambs are sold and new ewes are bought in. The local word for ram is "tup" and for ewe "yow". In November and December winter feeding begins again.Milking is done daily on the farm.
